ratings.comment: Just a Rabbi tryin' to get by

Noah never stops during a lecture. He thought everyone was following just fine so he never ask us if we need any clarification. Many proofs in class was not complete and always "leave as an exercise". No in-class explanations on the questions from the midterm. Solutions to the homework after the midterm were never given. Office hr cancelled often.

Hoping his performance in high-level math course would be different from Calculus. Never mind. He can make good intuition for the material at the beginning and then go nonstop. Writing on the board faster than me writing with pen. Homework can be returned after 2 weeks of turning in and solutions for all not written until 3 days before the exam.

The worst math professor I've ever had. Not only was he the only professor to allow neither a formula sheet nor a notecard, but he went over the theory of little o for three weeks for no reason. He constantly was screwing up in class (little errors), but he was unforgiving of this on exams. His lectures no one went to because they were useless.

Noah did not know how to explain things correctly. I could sit in his class for an hour and 15 and not learn one thing. The examples he shows during lecture, if he does any at all, are usually not solved. Teach yourself by reading textbook and if you need help go to his office hours, he does teach there! Lecture is a waste, just go to discussion.

He was nice and passionate about math, unfortunately he was a horrible Calc 2 prof. He would go on tangents with proofs and unrelated math and only provide one complicated half-example for a concept. Never released things on time and made mistakes consistantly enough to leave notes unusable. So far behind we skipped cross product, a vital section.

Noah is very nice and it was his first time teaching lectures this year. Although he is a nice person, I didn't learn anything from lectures and stopped showing up and I still got an A in the class. However, I did have to read the book instead to know what was going on and I had a good TA. The tests are fair, exactly the same as practice tests
It was his first time lecturing so I'll cut him some slack. He was disorganized and made mistakes but he's a solid lecturer and does a good job explaining things. Tests were actually pretty fair.
Even though he made a few mistakes during the lecture now and then, he is caring and clear on the topics.

Noah is clearly enthusiastic about math, but he doesnt know how to dumb it down enough for Calc 2 students. His lectures are very slow and confusing, and he often has to send out correction emails after class. Exams are similar to practice ones, but more difficult and harshly graded. He clearly does not know how to work with undergraduates.

Nash is a nice person as many other said. However, he spend most of the time writing things that are not necessary to write down. We had about 17 homework, but he only posted solutions for one. The final exam is way too difficult. I definitely not recommend choosing him as your 222 professor.

Noah is a very nice person, but he's a horrid professor. His mistakes in lecture happen so often that going to lecture can sometimes make you more confused about a topic than reading the book. He also never released anything on time and most of the times it seems like your paying for a class on how to teach yourself calc 2.

Noah is a nice guy and really tries hard. He makes a bunch of mistakes during lecture and often goes over material that doesn't really matter. Exams made up 90% of the overall grade. Falls behind during lecture.

yung goat!!! Super funny guy who loves to toss his chalk at the board! I don't think any 222 professor is good so it doesn't really matter who you get, but Professor Schweber is one of the best, just be prepared to learn it all outside of class!

He's a nice guy and pretty inspirational. Though his classes are sometimes a little bit confusing, previewing the textbook would be helpful and make the class easier. He is extremely helpful during office hours. A very approachable professor.

I wanted to like Schweber however his lectures are not organized at all. He is often forgetful and is unclear in his explanations of topics. He spends the majority of lecture redoing things that he messed up and when he realizes he is in a time crunch will often skip over examples and tell the class to refer to the book.

I really wanted to like Schweber. He's a nice guy--definitely an awkward one too. The thing about him that aggravates me is he messes up a lot in class and spends a lot of time redoing things. For the first midterm, the practice test was wAY easier than the exam. He didn't even make a practice for the second one. Could've been worse.
Lectures are confusing and he is very forgetful. Seems like a nice guy but I wouldn't take his class again
By my clock it is now 9:30 Super cool young dude. Smart as heck. And dumbs stuff down even for Engineering majors.
Ok
